name: Nicole
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
Nice, spacious place for my husband and I to unwind a bit after living the motel life for almost two weeks. The patio and deck out back were great (especially if you’re a birder, which we aren’t, but there was definitely a ton of bird activity!) and very nicely maintained.
It is close to a busy street and train track, so if you’re looking for absolute peace and quiet, it’s not always 100%—but, we’re from the city, so a little bit of street noise here and there doesn’t bother us, especially when you get to sit underneath the night sky and pick out new constellations.
And just for anyone with mobility concerns when it comes to showering, the floor is a bit slippery and slanted (obviously, to drain) and there isn’t really anything to hold on to. There is a grab bar, but it’s outside of the shower on the wall opposite to the faucet.
And to be sure, these aren’t complaints or criticisms, just observations for future guests!
Great place and hosts and I definitely would stay here again!

name: Pavel
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I stay in a lot of airbnbs and have high cleanliness and maintenance standards.
This airbnb was ok.
Very small space, low ceilings. Bedroom light was 3 feet over the bed.
Noisy neighbourhood. Trucks with no mufflers driving around in the night. You are not only "likely" to hear the train during your stay, you will be hearing it behind your wall all day starting at 6-7am and ending after 11pm.
Tile in the bathroom is cracking and falling off the wall.
Shower stall floor and corners are really moldy. Windows are dirty and have spiderwebs.
Window blinds have broken pieces.
Dusty AC vents.
Couch is broken in the middle.
Grill outside was nasty and never been cleaned.
Piles of leaves on the porch.
Didn't feel comfortable or relaxed there.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: We had a nice stay in Jen’s house. The breakfast gift certificate and the coffee in the house were appreciated. The place heated up quickly, which was nice, but the air conditioning unit in the window made the bedroom drafty. The unit was reasonably clean, but there were some spots, like drawers in the bedroom, or windows, that needed a little more attention. If you want to cook, bring your spices and condiments, we found pepper, sugar, and oil. The small issue we ran into, is that the checkin instructions are not provided until almost the time of checkin. We received them 23 minutes before checkin—we were already in the area and did not have good cell service. We ended up driving around looking for signal, so we could open the message. It was a packed multi-destination trip, planned to the smallest detail and 30-min. time increment itinerary, so this did not provide for a stress-free travel experience.

Easy to get in and out of. We pull a small trailer with our ATV or SxS on it and there is plenty of parking off street with room to turn around. Great view of the river and the activities there, summer and winter. We have stayed at this property several times and will continue to do so when we are in Carlsbad, NM.
Jenn has always been very responsive to any questions we might have. The place always feels clean and fresh whenever you walk in the door. All furniture, linens, towels, etc. are top quality and in excellent shape.

name: Suzanne
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Enjoyed our stay in this spacious little hacienda! It reminded me of my grandparents' house--it's older, but that makes it charming. The bed was comfy, the location was great, and there was a big back yard and back porch. There is a train bridge over the river--very close to the house. I like trains, so watching the train crossing the bridge over the foggy river in the morning sunlight was very cool. We did not hear the train at night. We enjoyed a great breakfast in the outdoor seating area at the Blue House Bakery & Cafe with a voucher provided by the property owners. We also had this amazing concoction of tiny donuts, soft-serve ice cream, butterscotch syrup, and a mixture of cinnamon and sugar, topped with whipped cream at SIPS Sodas & Snacks, which is less than a mile down the road. GPS places this house's address at the townhouse complex next door. This was a great place to stay after camping at Guadalupe Mountains NP, then visiting Carlsbad Caverns NP!

review_text: I can’t put into words how peaceful this place is. It is surprisingly charming. I loved so many of the little things from the old doors to the little surprise in the backyard. It is updated but not complete modern. I loved the tiny kitchen, the cabinets were my favorite part. It had everything we needed for an overnight stay. Including a Brita water pitcher. Jenn was very detailed in her initial emails and we didn’t have to contact her during our stay. I messaged her early the next morning to let her know we were checked out early and she responded very quickly. Seriously, if they ever decide to add a hot tub to this amazing little place they will not be able to get rid of me. I will be booking all the time. As it is, I hope I get the opportunity to book again and stay longer. The fish in that river are calling my name.

Wonderful property! Lakeside casita in the Chihuahuan desert, pretty amazing. Even better, the hosts are hospitality experts. The casita is beautifully decorated and had everything we needed for a very pleasant stay. Fishing off the dock and taking a run or walk on the nearby lakeside paved path were especially memorable. Loved the casita patio to watch the boats run up & down the lake. Well cooled in hot weather. Very comfortable bedding and towels. Very clean. Spend more than 1 night to explore Carlsbad and the caverns.
Pro dining tips:
Eat a breakfast at the Blue House Cafe
Eat a dinner at the Carniceria San Juan De Los Lagos
You'll walk away from both with a smile and a great meal.

name: Mark And Selena
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Riverside House #2 is a gem on the banks of the Pecos river. We brought 2 cars to one of the largest car shows in NM. Jenn was prompt in assuring us the property had enough parking for our cars & the neighborhood was safe. Both were true. Jenn was very helpful after I left my phone in the house & couldn't remember the lock code. Jenn promptly called my wife with the code and all was well.
Check in/out was a breeze; all we needed to do was wash dishes & pick up any mess we made. Clear instructions were provided & the property is easy to find. Grocery stores & restaurants a reasonable distance away. We agree with those who described the property as "rustic" but don't let this discourage you. The property is very clean with all the right amenities. Plenty of hot water & fluffy towels. Comfy bed. Just right for 1 or 2 per.; short/medium stays. Relaxing on the back porch while watching the river was great. Train noise at times but not after about 9pm. Mostly quiet neighborhood. Great stay!

name: Peter
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Wonderful place! We will be back. Place was very clean and the location on the Pecos river was fantastic. We spent a lot of time on the back patio watching folks boating, kayaking and jet skiing along the river. We also enjoyed watching a good variety of birds and water fowl. The vibe is “family cabin” and the place is a bit rustic but it was clean and comfortable. The bed was super comfortable and the kitchen had all the basics although we did not cook while there. We also received a voucher for a wonderful breakfast at the Blue House Bakery which is owned by the owners of the property. There is city noise and you can hear the train but by around 9-10 PM it is quiet and we had no issues sleeping.

name: Gary
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Great manager of the property. Owner has a great location and hires the best to insure the place is clean and equipped with excellent amenities. Great parking, private, easy access to the river and has a great view of the river from the back porch. Instructions were clear. Manager did not expect us to do all the cleaning work before we left, simply asked that we wash any dishes we used. At others we have paid an extravagant fee for cleaning and then were required to clean the place, start laundry, take trash to the dumpster and even move the dumpster to the curb. No such thing here. On top of the good service and clean facility, we received a coupon for a free breakfast on each morning we were there at one of the best restaurants in Carlsbad (The Blue House). Also, the location is very quite, with little if any, street noise. All linens were like new and the towels were thick, not "blue light specials" as some use.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Jenn was awesome with communicating- great response time, and was able to get us a booking for the night - we were there in 20 minutes! That’s great service! We also immediately added a 2nd night- which Jenn also quickly managed. The pictures are accurate, but fail to show the aging. It was clean, except for the windows, which were dirty, cobwebbed and cracked. The door locks need work- front door bolt doesn’t catch. Years ago, I’m sure it was a stunning tiny home. Also, for a couples retreat, the man cave two seater couch with cup holders in between the seats needs to go. A couch with a coffee table would be more ideal. The bed was very neat and clean and comfortable, and the shower was roomy and had ample hot water and great water pressure! It was a welcomed break from camping/hiking in the Lincoln National Forest, and Jenn did a fantastic job handling our booking.

review_text: My husband and I stayed at Jared's place for two nights while we were visiting Carlsbad Caverns. The unit was clean and comfortable, and Jared provided lots of "extras" like coffee pods for the Keurig and shampoo/conditioner/body wash. The bath towels were nice and fluffy, too! We didn't use the kitchen so can't speak to that, but it appeared to be well stocked. The alley from which we accessed the parking was a bit run down, but otherwise the neighborhood seemed nice and safe. Access to Carlsbad Caverns was quick (about 25 minute drive) and easy, as was access to a laundromat, car wash, gas station, etc. We also found a decent barbecue place that is very nearby. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay and recommend Jared's place.

name: George
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
This place was great! Host was always ready to help with any questions I had.
I travel for work and don't have much downtime. The amenities provided were just what I needed to relax after work. The bed was very comfortable and the place has two air conditioners. That made it very nice. Ran one for cool and the other for the fan noise which helps me sleep.
The outdoor grill was perfect for steaks and had plenty of propane. Has a kereg coffee maker. I used that religiously. I left a 48 count dunkin doughnuts k cup box for the next occupants to enjoy.
If you forget any bathing items he has you covered. There were many various soaps, body washes, shampoos and conditioners available.
All in all I enjoyed my stay away from home very much thanks to Jared's thoughtfulness and planning. I highly recommend this host and would definitely stay here again.
Safe travels!

review_text: This is a cozy spot to stay in the city of Carlsbad. It's close to a lot of places in town, including a park along the Pecos River, and it's about a 40-minute drive from here to Carlsbad Cavern. The bed is comfy, the AC worked well, there's a nice shower, and the TV had access to Amazon Prime and Netflix. The area was very quiet while I was there (four nights). You have to park in a small spot off an alley, so I was thankful (again) for my little car. If you're looking for an inexpensive place to stay in this area, I would recommend this spot.

review_text:
The good: The place was clean and there were no unpleasant odors. The location was good and convenient to restaurants and shopping.
The bad: Kitchen trash can was left full from previous guests. The furnishings
were very inexpensive but in good shape. The bed was uncomfortable and pretty hard to sleep on. Matress should be replaced with a much softer one. No direct contact with the host even just to make sure we had everything we needed. All communication was through text message. Very tight parking off of the back alley. The host started watering his lawn and sprayed water over the fence with the automatic sprinkler at the front door causing us to have to make a mad dash to get in the door without getting wet. Lots of room for improvement.

name: Allison
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
1 week ago
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: There were a series of preventable issues that the host did not deem appropriate for a discount in fees. I reached out early in my stay because there was a terrible smell in the bathroom, they said it could be the washer. I was only there for a night, so I said they could resolve it after I left. The AC was set too low by the housekeeper and it froze, ejecting ice from the vent onto the floor at midnight, waking me from my sleep. I did a load of wash and after 4 cycles it still wasn't dry! There was also a slime needing cleaning in the kettle, which I did. When I asked for a discount, they didn’t think it was reasonable to: I should have let them know about the kettle so they could address it (at an hour before checkout), they could have taught me how to use their dryer, at 9:45 pm and they said, basically, when you travel things go wrong. No apologies or responsibility. It was a gorgeous listing but I didn’t appreciate the request of a 5 star review after my experience. It felt lousy

name: Alexis
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
May 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Lovely little place for a weekend stay, very easy to get to Carlsbad Caverns from the house. Kitchen amenities including a countertop oven made cooking a breeze when we didn't want to to go out. The in-unit laundry is also a huge bonus for longer stays or traveling light.
If accessibility is a concern there are quirks to consider when staying in this tiny house including a tight toilet area, a low bed, and a reach through gate that requires a bit of dexterity due to lack of direct visualization of the latch.
As mentioned by other reviews, if you have a sensitive nose, the smell from the shower drain could impact your stay. Packing an air freshener couldn't hurt.
While the space felt curated and the fixtures were nice, there were a couple housekeeping misses including lack of regular pillow cases or spare linens, and a dirty keurig machine.
Overall, worth the price for the amenities.

And I had plenty of room to park my trailer as well a lot of benefits here you’re not exposed to any theft because you’re in a quiet, secluded neighborhood just a lot of benefits to this place to be honest. review_text: We really enjoyed our stay in this beautifully converted shipping container. It was our home base while visiting Carlsbad and its incredible caverns. Lots of area recommendations are listed inside the home, and Natalie is a friendly and responsive host. We were halfway through our two-week vacation, so the laundry facilities available in the home came in handy. Also, there's a little record player in the living room, so we were able to listen to some neat old records I'd picked up in Albuquerque and Santa Fe during our stay. It was a delightful added bonus! Thanks for everything!

Stayed one night
review_text: We unfortunately didn’t get to stay at Natalie’s property due to a medical emergency. After talking to Airbnb, and at their direction, I contacted Natalie to let her know of the situation. I never actually heard from Natalie besides the auto messages scheduled to be sent - even after letting her know about our schedule change. We are hosts as well and while we weren’t expecting a refund (though Airbnb told us they would request one anyway), it was a little weird to not hear anything from Natalie at all. About two days after our trip, Natalie left us a review even though we never ended up staying with her, which also made me uncomfortable. We were super excited for this stay and have no doubt it is a great find, we just wish the communication had been a little better.

The host response to this issue was nebulous, it is unclear whether the issue will be mitigated. No apologies were provided.

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: The unit is beyond adorable and about 98% of the pictures paint an accurate picture of the conditions. Natalie and the property manager were very informative and left us with no questions upon arrival. While we did not feel the rating should be decreased below 5 stars, my travel partner and I would like to give future travelers a heads up on two things we were disappointed by. The shower-head is much smaller than the one pictured, which would not be an issue except for the rolling temperatures of the water. The water would adjust from lukewarm, to cold and then extremely hot. If the shower-head wasn't so small, we might have been able to optimize the warm moments and avoid the discomfort. The other disappointment we experienced was the amount of hair left in the shower drain, bedroom floor and in the bed. After a 7.5 hour drive, we weren't in a place to request a fresh clean. Overall, we swept away the hair and had an AMAZING time with the fire pit and cozy energy. Great find!

review_text: I've stayed in shipping containers before, but this one was my favorite. Despite the small space of shopping containers, this one did not feel cramped at all. The layout was perfect, and they even had a washer and dryer, which was a must for me. Th decor was amazing as well. I bought groceries to cook breakfast and make myself lunch, and there was no cooking oil. Katherine seriously drove all the way to me to give me a bottle. To go above and beyond like that was so nice, I was very grateful. The record player was also such a nice touch, I loved pairing up my phone and listening to music in the morning and while cooking. The book with recommendations was so cute as well. I chose to stay in because this trip was mostly gor hiking and I was exhausted at the end of every day so I didn't feel like going out. But the fact that they provided that was such a nice touch. Now this is a small space just FYI, no more than 2 people, but it was perfect for me. Thank you so much for everything! ❤️

name: Mina
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
April 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: We felt lucky to find Natalie's place after deciding to drive down to Carlsbad from Santa Fe with short notice. I was truly impressed with how she made this shipping container feel so cozy and truly like a home - it's seriously decked out better than our apartment in NYC! I also got a lot of ideas about how to decorate a small space so efficiently. Nothing in this home feels small - everything is normal-sized, and once you're inside, it's incredible how you lack for nothing, but what I really loved was the enclosed patio. It's private and fenced, so I stayed out here in front of the fire pit watching the stars which is a lovely way to relax after a day at the caverns. It's also close enough that you can go for the evening or morning bat flights, so that was a plus. It's a great spot to access local businesses as well. We loved eating at Tina's Mexican Kitchen and visiting La Tienda Thriftway to get some choice Mexican treats! Overall, a short, albeit excellent stay!

Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This container home was great! It obviously is a small space but there is definitely enough room for 2 people, especially if you are in the area to get outside to the National Parks like we were. The home looked great and had everything you would need for a weekend away. We had the record player on constantly! I also loved the local recommendations. The first night we tried to get a fire started but were out of propane but when I messaged Chip and Natalie and they answered immediately and were over in about 10 minutes to help out! Unfortunately, it was too windy to get it to light so we did not get to use the fireplace but it was a great outdoor space! The only drawback to our stay would be that the water in the shower was not very warm (which I asked the hosts about and they mentioned they were actively working to fix it, so this may no longer be the case). If you are visiting in the warmer months this likely won't be an issue for you anyway. Overall I would definitely recommend!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This AirBnB is the best AirBnB I have ever stayed at! It was so clean and tastefully decorated, we were consistently marveling at all the little touches and the overwhelming sense of this being a clean, new home inside. We loved the new flooring throughout the house, we never felt the need to keep our shoes on for protection, haha. There were simple intentional amenities that were a nice surprise, such as the power stations for plus/usb on either side of the beds, nice bedside lamps in addition to the overhead lamps/fans, great removable shower heads with good water pressure, large quality shampoo/conditioner/soap, plenty of clean, fresh bathroom linens, coffee pot and Keurig, plenty of kitchen utensils, coffee mugs, plates/cups, etc. The house was very spacious, and well-lit, enabling us to have a wonderful Thanksgiving in the home. Thank you, Jakoda, for making this such a delightful home and enabling us to have a great experience here!

The kitchen is state-of-the-art. The neighborhood is very quiet - except for a train coming through semi-late one morning, but it was charming. Noisy neighbors is always my main worry - 'Not a problem at Jacoda's.

review_text: Simple and clean, with a mini-kitchen. This casita is located on the south side of Carlsbad, which made it convenient for driving to Carlsbad Caverns and Guadalupe Mountains National Parks. The town has a surprising level of traffic and stoplights, so staying on the south side probably saved us 15 or 20 minutes each way. Helpful when you have an 8:30 ticket to the cave! There are a lot of oil and gas trucks in town, and you could hear some traffic noise from those in the early mornings. Quiet at night. Visit the Blue House Cafe for great breakfast burritos and baked goods!

review_text: Tammy was amazing throughout our one night stay! My fiancé and I were worried about not getting the privacy we wanted while staying in her backyard but she made us feel completely comfortable! She welcomed us and let us know she would be there if we needed anything and then gave us our space. The space itself was very clean and accommodating. The coffee maker was a huge plus 😉. She let us have access to her patio which had a nice outdoor seating area as well as a grill! The sauna was amazing, the bedroom had a window AC unit so the bedroom was cool despite the heat from the sauna. Tess was our favorite part and why we chose this Airbnb! She was such a sweet dog! She really only came to us if we called her over for pets so if you are worried she would bother you, don’t be! We plan on coming back to visit the caverns again and will be staying here each time we are in the area!

Being such a short drive to the parks in addition to all of these other wonderful qualities, I will be recommending this place to my family and friends the next time they past through Carlsbad!! Thank you again for going above and beyond in so many reasons!!

review_text:
This place was very unique and extremely central in the town. It made getting around town super easy!
The only downside we noticed was that you couldn’t take longer than 10 minute showers or the water would turn pretty cold. Also, if you get hot at night just be sure to bring a fan for the bedroom.
Other than that it was extremely beautiful and so clean! The fireplace in the bedroom was a super cute light at night and you can either use the fireplace for heat or just the light.
Communication was easy and the host is very responsive so that’s awesome! Detailed instructions for the stay are sent beforehand and they’re very helpful!

If you’re wondering if you should stay here, the answer is yes!! I bet it’s the nicest place in Carlsbad.

review_text:
This place is a gem. Doesn’t look like much from the outside, but wow when you go in it is amazing. Very decorative, really unique touches. It’s definitely decorative over functionality but isn’t that what you want when you are trying to “get away”. The kitchen, master bathroom and all the cool lighting was a plus. I’ve stayed in a lot of places and this one was the most unique.
It is also centrally located to everything needed in Carlsbad. 30min from the caverns and about 50min from Guadalupe. The drives seem faster though.

review_text:
My wife and I loved staying here. The kitchen was huge with lots of counter-top space and a giant refrigerator, and if we had been planning on cooking it would have more than met our needs.
The bed was extremely comfortable, so much that whatever mattress they have THAT is the one I'd like to upgrade our own home to!
What really sets this home apart is the location and decor. Built into an old church sanctuary, and decorated with genuine Indian decor, it's one-of-a-kind. A lot of the hardware (doors, entryways, etc.) seems to be from the original church - which makes it a bit unusual but I really liked the authentic feel of it. The bathtub and shower are both very nice. We really enjoyed our stay!

The other thing is there isn’t a actual couch there’s a love seat and chairs that are very hard and straight backed. After our long day of hiking/sightseeing in the sun it would have been amazing to be able to lounge and watch tv.

We highly recommend staying here and hope to visit again in the future!

review_text:
The house itself is charming, and there is clearly a lot of money and effort spent on the furniture and decorations. However, the good things about the house end at that. First major problem is the location.. it’s in an isolated part of town, right across the street from the adult detention center. It’s pretty loud too with all the cars passing by.
Secondly, the furniture in the living room was uncomfortable and odd. The couch would really only fit one person, if two people were to sit it’s pretty uncomfortable. There were too many random useless chairs and tables when they could’ve just had a couple of nice couches.
Lastly, I had so much trouble just unlocking the front door. The lockbox did not work well for me at all and caused frustration every single time, as I would try to get inside while standing in the freezing cold. The keypad/lock kept getting stuck and the front door wouldn’t open until the 7th or 8th try.

review_text: Absolutely idyllic church-cottage :) I was a little worried about some of the reviews (keep reading), but my husband and loved our stay here - every need was anticipated (e.g., wine bottle opener, hand soap and lotion bc it’s soo dry here, makeup towels, even dental kits in case you forgot yours!). Some of the reviews freaked me out saying there is no bathroom door. Nah - there’s a perfectly normal bathroom with a normal door. There’s also a larger bath/shower/tub room that has a pretty barn door if you feel the need to close something, and there’s a shutter-like door to the water closet. It’s all beautiful, luxurious, and totally fine - don’t worry. We stayed here to hike Guadalupe and visit the Caverns and it was perfect. Thank you!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Overall a great experience!
To start, although the location is in a strange area, it was still easy to find, within walking distance to restaurants and grocery stores.
Once inside, the house itself is gorgeous. Very eclectic and nothing like anything I have ever seen, which made the experience more exciting. My only wish was that there was a bigger couch for lounging and laying down on.
For the bedroom, it was open concept with the bathroom, so there is little privacy (which may be uncomfortable for some, and luckily there is a separate bathroom adjacent to the bedroom that has a door and lock if needed). The bed is firm, but comfortable. The bathroom is spacious, providing a huge standing shower and a big bathtub.
We enjoyed our stay a lot, and it was fun exploring the town and National park nearby!

review_text: The space was beautiful & very well done. Love the furnishings & little touches. Plenty of room & seating for our families to gather, & a well-stocked chef’s kitchen. Very romantic for the 2 of us when we weren’t with the rest of the family. Had a wonderful time cooking & playing games on our Thanksgiving holiday. Only downside is it’s not very well-lit throughout, & feels dark when cooking & sitting at the table for dining & games, & getting ready. A few of the decorative lamp bulbs were burned out which might have helped a bit, but it really needs more overhead lighting, or a floor lamp. This was our only complaint really~could use some hooks in the foyer for coats/hanging clothes; the bar in the armoire isn’t usable due to a shelf. We tightened 2 of the door locks that were loose, as the front door was “catchy” & a kitchen breaker popped the last night but host was very responsive. Beautiful former church with what seemed to be original doorframes that we loved ~ very unique!

The walk in shower was nice and the claw foot bathtub was much needed after a long day of hiking. The bed was big and comfortable. We took pictures of the interior to show our friends. Great place!

The master bedroom was cool but the bathroom in the master has no doors to the toilet or to the bedroom. But all in all it was good for a nights stay.

review_text: Elizabeth’s place is indeed a sanctuary in the middle of Carlsbad. The pictures are accurate (except there is an extra sofa in the living area) and only give a glimpse of the luxuriousness, it feels even more so in person! Elizabeth definitely has a flair for decorating and comfort. It was sparkling clean, spacious, comfortable and the central heat worked well. The TV is first rate (65”, and very sharp, with netflix and others available). Check in/out was extremely easy and parking was right in front of the door. The apartment is on somewhat of a main thoroughfare, but with double-paned windows and the bedroom in the back, traffic noise did not bother us. Jenn was very communicative, warm and friendly. We would highly recommend this place.

review_text:
"Sanctuary" the perfect name for this little home away from home. My husband and I just spent Thanksgiving Weekend there. We were able to cook our own little Thanksgiving feast in the chef's kitchen. The bed was really comfortable, the hospitality was on point. The architectural design in this old church is really spectacular, they did an amazing job with the lighting, incorporating the very old pieces of history and thinking of thing after thing that just keeps catching your eye. The bath was so relaxing, the fireplace in the bedroom was so soothing to lay there and read after a long bath.
We visited the Carlsbad Caverns one day and the "Christmas on the Pecos" was a definite must see. Take a blanket (thanks Jenn) and dress warm. I've already recommended to a few of my friends. Thanks Again for such a relaxing weekend.

We stayed here 5 nights. The place was spotless, and accurately matches the description. We had everything we needed. Jenn was very responsive and even reminded us to reserve entry to Carlsbad park 30 days in advance.
The location is great for exploring Carlsbad National Park, plus Guadalupe NP and Bitter Lake National Wildlife Refuge are both not too far away. The area around the house is quiet and there is a grocery store within walking distance.
We definitely would stay again if we return to this area of New Mexico.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I had a fantastic four-night stay at Casa de Roitan! We used Carlsbad as our base to explore Guadalupe Mountains National Park, Carlsbad Caverns, and even Roswell. All of those sites were within an hour or less easy drive. Jenn's house was just perfect for us, with plenty of space to spread out. We enjoyed passing by peaceful evenings on the porch, enjoying a beer. We also cooked all four of our dinners in the well-stocked kitchen which was a really nice bonus. We appreciated the in-refrigerator filtered water and the Keurig coffee pods and other coffee choices that were available for us in the house. The wifi was also very strong, helping us to plan our hikes each day. We would not hesitate to recommend Casa de Roitan for other explorers!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: Pleasant stay at the Casa. The house is a really neat old home, which I enjoyed. Walking distance to some downtown restaurants and brew pub, and provided a good spot for driving to the Cavern and Guadalupe NP. The house looked a bit better in the photos, so don’t expect the same “staging” look, but it’s quite roomy & clean, with some neat southwest touches. I was disappointed to find out the fireplace is only decorative and the bed in the master, while comfortable overall, the mattress was slightly sloped. The coffee bar was great and the host left us some Easter candy! Appreciated that all we had to do before checkout was run the dishwasher and empty the bathroom trash into the large kitchen trash. Jenn was extremely quick to respond to messages/questions.

We had 4 adults in our group, used all the bedrooms, all were comfortable. We enjoyed the unique floorplan and squirrels outside. Great hot water. We used this as a midpoint for sight-seeing for several days. Plenty of towels, kitchen towels, extra throws, blankets for chiller weather. Heater works, however, our group prefers chilly temps for sleeping. would definitely recommend Jenn and Elizabeth's place.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
We stayed for 3 nights to explore the Carlsbad Caverns which are definitely worth seeing. It's clearly an old property but they did a nice job renovating it. The nicely restored original wooden floor is a highlight.
A large supermarket (Albertsons) is within walking distance.
Just two things that we think need improvement:
- The lighting throughout the property. All the dim light bulbs should be replaced with at least double as strong ones. We found it straining on the eye to not be able to fully turn on the lights.
- The smell. The building has a very strong odor (probably from the old wooden structures or moisture?) which is mixing with even stronger artificial scents that we think make things just worse.

name: Allyson
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
October 2020
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
This was a very nice and spacious place to stay and was very close to great food and coffee. The house was very well appointed, and Jenn took efforts to include special touches: jazz music playing upon our arrival, toothbrushes, and coffee. Jenn’s communication was excellent, and check-in and check-out were easy.
The only possible drawback for families may be the location. This very cute house is the only residential house in the area, and is surrounded by houses used for commercial purposes. The central location would be perfect for travelers without children, but we were a little uneasy letting the kids out of our sight in this non-residential neighborhood. Otherwise, there are several benefits to the location, which is walking distance to great restaurants and cafes.
This was a clean, comfortable, cute and welcoming place to stay in Carlsbad. I highly recommend it, as long as you are comfortable in a mostly commercial area.
